result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  any other sentence.  Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving one half (1/2) Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: same as probation condition,  exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.  
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens. No positive results.
Mental health assessment.   Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center.  No good time.  No electronic monitoring. 
First three months forthwith.  
Balance of two months STAYED: to be used by agent for violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominique D Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant, received and filed in cases 14CF670 and 14CF4370.
Original SENTENCING Transcript (29 pages) commencing OCTOBER 29, 2014 received and filed.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked     (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:   03-04-2015        Initials:  AAC

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3.5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 26 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3
years with the following conditions:
*Court imposed 5 months of condition time in the HOC with Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center.  No good time.  NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.   FIRST 3 MONTHS FORTHWITH.  SECOND TWO MONTHS IMPOSED BUT STAYED TO BE USED BY AGENT FOR VIOLATIONS.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation.  If revoked, to be collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- If revoked, defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

If revoked, conditions of probation to revert to conditions of ES with the exception of the condition time.
Case rescheduled to 10-29-14, 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Robert E Haney for Patrick Rupich.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court.  Lucy Kronforst for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant unable to contact attorney Rupich.  Public Defender Richard Carpenter in court.  Court passes case to allow attorney Carpenter to interview defendant. 

Case recalled.  Richard Carpenter appears in court with defendant.  Defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 34 for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on the 6/5 letter from Atty Rupich, matter rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
